title: 111_hr4655
content: The "Small Business Expansion and Job Creation Act of 2010" extends the limitation on expensing certain depreciable business assets for the years 2009 and 2010. Additionally, it provides a special allowance for property acquired during 2010. The "Small Business Expansion and Job Creation Act of 2010" extends the special allowance for property acquired during 2010 by amending the Internal Revenue Code to change the dates from January 1, 2011, to January 1, 2012, and from January 1, 2010, to January 1, 2011. Various headings and clauses in the Code are also amended to reflect these date changes. The Code is amended to change dates from January 1, 2009 to January 1, 2010 in various sections. Additionally, the election to accelerate the AMT and research credits in lieu of bonus depreciation is extended from January 1, 2010 to January 1, 2011. The Code is amended to change dates from January 1, 2009 to January 1, 2010 in various sections. The election to accelerate the AMT and research credits in lieu of bonus depreciation is extended from January 1, 2010 to January 1, 2011. Special rules for 2010 extension property are outlined for taxpayers who previously made certain elections. The paragraph discusses the computation and application of bonus depreciation amounts for eligible qualified property in 2010 extension property. Taxpayers who did not previously elect acceleration have the option to make the election for their taxable years. The taxpayer can elect to apply bonus depreciation to their first taxable year ending after December 31, 2009, and subsequent years, specifically for eligible qualified property that is 2010 extension property. The term '2010 extension property' refers to property that qualifies solely because of this provision. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2009, in taxable years ending after that date.
